021package com.bewsoftware.utils.crypto;
022
023import java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException;
024import java.security.SecureRandom;
025import java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException;
026import java.util.Base64;
027import javax.crypto.KeyGenerator;
028import javax.crypto.SecretKey;
029import javax.crypto.SecretKeyFactory;
030import javax.crypto.spec.PBEKeySpec;
031import javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec;
032
033/**
034 * Secure Password Storage v2.0.
035 * <p>
036 * PBKDF2 salted password hashing with HMAC and SHA512.
037 * <p>
038 * Source:
039 * <a href="https://github.com/defuse/password-hashing/blob/master/PasswordStorage.java">
040 * https://github.com/defuse/password-hashing/blob/master/PasswordStorage.java</a>
041 * <p>
042 * Downloaded: 07/10/2021.
043 * <p>
044 * Renamed and modified by Bradley Willcott
045 *
046 * @author Taylor Hornby @ defuse.ca
047 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
048 *
049 * @since v1.0.10
050 * @version v1.0.10
051 */
052public class PBKDF2
053{
054    private static final String HASH_ALGORITHM = "sha512";// Was "sha1"
055
056    private static final int HASH_ALGORITHM_INDEX = 0;
057
058    // May be changed without breaking existing hashes.
059    private static final int HASH_BYTE_SIZE = 512;// Was 18
060
061    // These constants define the encoding and may not be changed.
062    private static final int HASH_SECTIONS = 5;
063
064    private static final int HASH_SIZE_INDEX = 2;
065
066    private static final int ITERATION_INDEX = 1;
067
068    // Used by the main() method in for loop test.
069    private static final int NUM_OF_TEST_CYCLES = 10;// Was 100
070
071    private static final String PBKDF2_ALGORITHM = "PBKDF2WithHmacSHA512";// Was "...SHA1"
072
073    private static final int PBKDF2_INDEX = 4;
074
075    // May be changed without breaking existing hashes.
076    private static final int PBKDF2_ITERATIONS = 100000;// Was 64000
077
078    // These constants may be changed without breaking existing hashes.
079    private static final int SALT_BYTE_SIZE = HASH_BYTE_SIZE;// Was 24
080
081    private static final int SALT_INDEX = 3;
082
083    /**
084     * Returns a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password.
085     *
086     * @param password the password to hash
087     *
088     * @return a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password
089     *
090     * @throws CannotPerformOperationException
091     */
092    public static String createHash(String password)
093            throws CannotPerformOperationException
094    {
095        // Generate a random salt
096        SecureRandom random = new SecureRandom();
097        byte[] salt = new byte[SALT_BYTE_SIZE];
098        random.nextBytes(salt);
099
100        // Hash the password
101        byte[] hash = pbkdf2(password.toCharArray(), salt, PBKDF2_ITERATIONS,
102                HASH_BYTE_SIZE);
103        int hashSize = hash.length;
104
105        // format: algorithm:iterations:hashSize:salt:hash
106        return HASH_ALGORITHM
107                + ":"
108                + PBKDF2_ITERATIONS
109                + ":" + hashSize
110                + ":"
111                + toBase64(salt)
112                + ":"
113                + toBase64(hash);
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Generate an AES key with size of {@code n} (128, 192, and 256) bits.
118     * <p>
119     * Source:
120     * <a href="https://www.baeldung.com/java-aes-encryption-decryption">
121     * https://www.baeldung.com/java-aes-encryption-decryption</a>
122      * <p>
123     * Modified by Bradley Willcott (06/10/2021)
124     *
125     * @param n size of key to generate (in bits)
126     *
127     * @return generated secret key
128     *
129     * @throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
130     */
131    public static SecretKey generateKey(int n) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
132    {
133        KeyGenerator keyGenerator = KeyGenerator.getInstance("AES");
134        keyGenerator.init(n);
135        return keyGenerator.generateKey();
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Generate an AES key from a given password.
140     * <p>
141     * Source:
142     * <a href="https://www.baeldung.com/java-aes-encryption-decryption">
143     * https://www.baeldung.com/java-aes-encryption-decryption</a>
144     * <p>
145     * Modified by Bradley Willcott (06/10/2021)
146     *
147     * @param password to use
148     * @param salt     to use
149     *
150     * @return generated secret key
151     *
152     * @throws CannotPerformOperationException
153     */
154    public static SecretKey getKeyFromPassword(String password, String salt)
155            throws CannotPerformOperationException
156
157    {
158        byte[] passwordHash = pbkdf2(password.toCharArray(), salt.getBytes(),
159                ITERATION_INDEX, HASH_BYTE_SIZE);
160        return new SecretKeySpec(passwordHash, "AES");
161    }
162
163    /**
164     * Tests the basic functionality of the PBKDF2 class
165     *
166     * @param args ignored
167     */
168    public static void main(String[] args)
169    {
170        try
171        {
172            // Print out 10 hashes
173            for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
174            {
175                System.out.println(createHash("p\r\nassw0Rd!"));
176            }
177
178            // Test password validation
179            boolean failure = false;
180            System.out.println("Running tests...");
181            for (int i = 0; i < NUM_OF_TEST_CYCLES; i++)
182            {
183                String password = "" + i;
184                String hash = createHash(password);
185                String secondHash = createHash(password);
186
187                if (hash.equals(secondHash))
188                {
189                    System.out.println("FAILURE: TWO HASHES ARE EQUAL!");
190                    failure = true;
191                }
192
193                String wrongPassword = "" + (i + 1);
194
195                if (verifyPassword(wrongPassword, hash))
196                {
197                    System.out.println("FAILURE: WRONG PASSWORD ACCEPTED!");
198                    failure = true;
199                }
200
201                if (!verifyPassword(password, hash))
202                {
203                    System.out.println("FAILURE: GOOD PASSWORD NOT ACCEPTED!");
204                    failure = true;
205                }
206            }
207            if (failure)
208            {
209                System.out.println("TESTS FAILED!");
210            } else
211            {
212                System.out.println("TESTS PASSED!");
213            }
214        } catch (Exception ex)
215        {
216            System.out.println("ERROR: " + ex);
217        }
218    }
219
220    /**
221     * Validates a password using a hash.
222     *
223     * @param password    the password to check
224     * @param correctHash the hash of the valid password
225     *
226     * @return {@code true} if the password is correct, {@code false} if not
227     *
228     * @throws CannotPerformOperationException
229     * @throws InvalidHashException
230     */
231    public static boolean verifyPassword(String password, String correctHash)
232            throws CannotPerformOperationException, InvalidHashException
233    {
234        // Decode the hash into its parameters
235        String[] params = correctHash.split(":");
236        if (params.length != HASH_SECTIONS)
237        {
238            throw new InvalidHashException(
239                    "Fields are missing from the password hash."
240            );
241        }
242
243        // Currently, Java only supports SHA1.
244        if (!params[HASH_ALGORITHM_INDEX].equals(HASH_ALGORITHM))
245        {
246            throw new CannotPerformOperationException(
247                    "Unsupported hash type."
248            );
249        }
250
251        int iterations = 0;
252        try
253        {
254            iterations = Integer.parseInt(params[ITERATION_INDEX]);
255        } catch (NumberFormatException ex)
256        {
257            throw new InvalidHashException(
258                    "Could not parse the iteration count as an integer.",
259                    ex
260            );
261        }
262
263        if (iterations < 1)
264        {
265            throw new InvalidHashException(
266                    "Invalid number of iterations. Must be >= 1."
267            );
268        }
269
270        byte[] salt = null;
271        try
272        {
273            salt = fromBase64(params[SALT_INDEX]);
274        } catch (IllegalArgumentException ex)
275        {
276            throw new InvalidHashException(
277                    "Base64 decoding of salt failed.",
278                    ex
279            );
280        }
281
282        byte[] hash = null;
283        try
284        {
285            hash = fromBase64(params[PBKDF2_INDEX]);
286        } catch (IllegalArgumentException ex)
287        {
288            throw new InvalidHashException(
289                    "Base64 decoding of pbkdf2 output failed.",
290                    ex
291            );
292        }
293
294        int storedHashSize = 0;
295        try
296        {
297            storedHashSize = Integer.parseInt(params[HASH_SIZE_INDEX]);
298        } catch (NumberFormatException ex)
299        {
300            throw new InvalidHashException(
301                    "Could not parse the hash size as an integer.",
302                    ex
303            );
304        }
305
306        if (storedHashSize != hash.length)
307        {
308            throw new InvalidHashException(
309                    "Hash length doesn't match stored hash length."
310            );
311        }
312
313        // Compute the hash of the provided password, using the same salt,
314        // iteration count, and hash length
315        byte[] testHash = pbkdf2(password.toCharArray(), salt, iterations, hash.length);
316        // Compare the hashes in constant time. The password is correct if
317        // both hashes match.
318        return slowEquals(hash, testHash);
319    }
320
321    /**
322     * Convert a string of Base64 characters into byte array.
323     *
324     * @param hex the Base64 text to convert
325     *
326     * @return the decoded text
327     *
328     * @throws IllegalArgumentException
329     */
330    private static byte[] fromBase64(String hex)
331            throws IllegalArgumentException
332    {
333        return Base64.getDecoder().decode(hex);
334    }
335
336    /**
337     * Computes the PBKDF2 hash of a password.
338     *
339     * @param password   the password to hash.
340     * @param salt       the salt
341     * @param iterations the iteration count (slowness factor)
342     * @param bytes      the length of the hash to compute in bytes
343     *
344     * @return the PBDKF2 hash of the password
345     *
346     * @throws CannotPerformOperationException
347     */
348    private static byte[] pbkdf2(char[] password, byte[] salt, int iterations, int bytes)
349            throws CannotPerformOperationException
350    {
351        try
352        {
353            PBEKeySpec spec = new PBEKeySpec(password, salt, iterations, bytes * 8);
354            SecretKeyFactory skf = SecretKeyFactory.getInstance(PBKDF2_ALGORITHM);
355            return skf.generateSecret(spec).getEncoded();
356        } catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException ex)
357        {
358            throw new CannotPerformOperationException(
359                    "Hash algorithm not supported.",
360                    ex
361            );
362        } catch (InvalidKeySpecException ex)
363        {
364            throw new CannotPerformOperationException(
365                    "Invalid key spec.",
366                    ex
367            );
368        }
369    }
370
371    /**
372     * Compares two byte arrays in length-constant time. This comparison method
373     * is used so that password hashes cannot be extracted from an on-line
374     * system using a timing attack and then attacked off-line.
375     *
376     * @param a the first byte array
377     * @param b the second byte array
378     *
379     * @return true if both byte arrays are the same, false if not
380     */
381    private static boolean slowEquals(byte[] a, byte[] b)
382    {
383        int diff = a.length ^ b.length;
384        for (int i = 0; i < a.length && i < b.length; i++)
385        {
386            diff |= a[i] ^ b[i];
387        }
388        return diff == 0;
389    }
390
391    /**
392     * Converts a byte array into a string of Base64 characters.
393     *
394     * @param array the byte array to convert
395     *
396     * @return the string of Base64 characters
397     */
398    private static String toBase64(byte[] array)
399    {
400        return Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(array);
401    }
402
403    /**
404     * This static helper class is not meant to be instantiated.
405     */
406    private PBKDF2()
407    {
408    }

410    /**
411     * This exception is thrown when something is wrong with the platform
412     * your code is running on, and for some reason it's not safe to verify a
413     * password on it.
414     */
415    @SuppressWarnings("serial")
416    public static class CannotPerformOperationException extends Exception
417    {
418        public CannotPerformOperationException(String message)
419        {
420            super(message);
421        }
422
423        public CannotPerformOperationException(String message, Throwable source)
424        {
425            super(message, source);
426        }
427    }
428
429    /**
430     * The {@code correctHash} parameter you gave to the
431     * {@link #verifyPassword(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) verifyPassword}
432     * method was somehow corrupted. Note that some ways of corrupting a hash
433     * are
434     * impossible to detect, and their only symptom will be that
435     * {@link #verifyPassword(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) verifyPassword}
436     * will return {@code false} even though the correct
437     * password was given. So {@code InvalidHashException} is not guaranteed to
438     * be
439     * thrown if a hash has been changed, but if it is thrown then you can be
440     * sure that the hash <i>was</i> changed.
441     */
442    @SuppressWarnings("serial")
443    public static class InvalidHashException extends Exception
444    {
445        public InvalidHashException(String message)
446        {
447            super(message);
448        }
449
450        public InvalidHashException(String message, Throwable source)
451        {
452            super(message, source);
453        }
454    }
